title: Poster, "The Yale Symphony Orchestra Presents Leonard Bernstein's Mass", ca. 1973
provenance: From the collection of Dan Friedman
description:
Poster presents text in staggered design printed in blue and turquoise with three distinct typographical fonts that fill the sheet. From top text in blue reads The Yale Symphony Orchestra presents Leonard Bernstein's Mass (Text from the Liturgy of the Roman / Mass with additional texts by Stephen / Schwartz and Leonard Bernstein) /  Saturday Februay 17 at 8:30 pm and / Sunday February 18 at 7:00 pm / in Woolsey Hall, New Haven / John Mauceri, Musical Director / Nora Peterson, Choreographer / and Richard Parke as the Celebrant / With the Yale Chorus, / Rodney Wynkoop, Director, / and the Trinity Boys Choir, Steve Loher, Director / Set design by Enno Poersch / Costumes by William Ivey Long / Lighting by Terry Gilbertson / Sound by John Zoring / Tickets $2.50 and $3.50 / available at the Yale Co-op.
Across lower edge of sheet in green letters, PAX

tombstone.epitaph:
Poster, "The Yale Symphony Orchestra Presents Leonard Bernstein's Mass", ca. 1973.
ca. 1973. Screenprint on white wove paper. Gift of Ken Friedman. 1997-19-268.
